thread.title: China’s Ports Have Iron Ore in Quantity—but How’s the Quality?

author: Rhiannon Hoyle
title: China’s Ports Have Iron Ore in Quantity—but How’s the Quality?
text: There’s enough iron ore sitting at Chinese ports right now to produce more than 100 million automobiles, in theory. The big question for market watchers: Just how good is the ore in reality? Benchmark iron-ore prices have already tumbled to around $65 a metric ton from $75 this year—a slide of almost 15%, making the   Do You Like That Stock, or Do You Just Love its Ticker?
